page.title: 20FORTON SCHOOL
page.content: In September 1985 Forton County Primary School has 86 children on roll.They are divided into 3 classes, comprising Infants(30),Lower Juniors (27) and Upper Juniors(29).There are three full time teachers, including the Headmaster, and 1 part time teacher(5 mornings).The school is a very modern building built in 1965 and stands opposite the old school , which was built in 1878 and is now the Village Hall. Our new school has 4 classrooms, a multi-purpose hall (dining hall,gym,assembly,concerts etc),work area,staff room, playground and playing field.This{Domesday {Project}has been carried out by the children of the Upper Junior class and by Mr Peter Jobbins, the headmaster.
